abstract: Gen Gilbert Diendere, who seized control of Burkina Faso in coup, apologizes for causing violence and vows to hand country back over to transitional government; African leaders broker deal requiring restoration of interim president Michel Kafando in exchange for allowing supporters of ousted president Blaise Compaore to participate in elections.
lead_paragraph: As troops advanced on the capital and angry protests continued, Gen. Gilbert Diendéré apologized and said he and his followers would stand down.

headline.main: An Apology and a Vow to End Burkina Faso Coup
headline.print_headline: An Apology and a Vow to End Burkina Faso Siege

snippet: As troops advanced on the capital and angry protests continued, Gen. Gilbert Diendéré apologized and said he and his followers would stand down.

keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
keywords.name: subject
